alert.note: Alert for Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; Marin Coastal Range; San Francisco; San Fransisco Peninsula Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 13 at 1:38AM PST until February 14 at 6:00AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 AM PST TUESDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM WEDNESDAY TO 9 AM WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, northwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. For the Freeze Watch, near freezing to sub-freezing temperatures as low as 30 to 38. * WHERE...San Francisco, Marin Coastal Range, Coastal North Bay, Including Point Reyes National Seashore and San Francisco Peninsula Coast. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, from 10 AM this morning to 6 AM PST Tuesday. For the Freeze Watch, from 2 am Wednesday to 9 am Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Frost and freeze conditions will impact unsheltered and marginally sheltered populations, could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

area.areaDesc: Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; Marin Coastal Range; San Francisco; San Fransisco Peninsula Coast
